title: How to Prep Your Xbox 360 for Shipping for Repair

steps.headline: First, you need to call 1-800-4MYXBOX.
steps.description:
If you prefer to go online, the proceed with steps 1a-
Go to xbox.com/support
Under, "Services," click, "Register and Repair your Product." Click on, "Request a Repair,"
Fill out the necessary information
Once completed, click on the console that you have just registered
Click on, "Request a Repair." Follow the steps, beginning with description of the problem and ending with review.

steps.headline: If you prefer to call, dial 1-800-4MYXBOX.
steps.description: A customer service representative should be with you, but please be patient.

steps.headline: Follow the directions from the representative.
steps.description: For shipping, go to the xbox.com/support. Under your consoles, there should be an option where you can print out a shipping label.

steps.headline: Once printed, find a medium-large size box.
steps.description: If there are any marking on the box, scratch them out.

steps.headline: Affix the shipping label to the top of the box.
Now, you need to pack your Xbox.
First, you need to remove the hard-drive.
steps.description: To do so, simply push-in the tab where the hard-drive is and the hard-drive should pop up.

steps.headline: After the hard-drive is removed, it is recommended that the faceplate be removed from the console.
steps.description: To do this, simply pull the faceplate off via the sides.

steps.headline: For easier assistance, type out a brief description of your problems with the console and include it in the box.
Now, time to wrap your Xbox.
First, find some bubble wrap.
steps.description: The kind with the smaller bubbles works best because it offers the most protection.

steps.headline: Wrap the bubble wrap around the Xbox, starting from the front, wrap it about 2-3 times around.
Affix the brief description to the top of the wrapped console with packing tape.
Once the Xbox is wrapped, get some packing insulation and put on the bottom (Some common packing materials are newspaper, packing peanuts, Styrofoam, etc).
Put a thin layer of the packing material on the bottom of the box.
Set your Xbox on top, and put more packing material on the sides.

text:
First, you need to call 1-800-4MYXBOX. If you prefer to go online, the proceed with steps 1a-
Go to xbox.com/support
Under, "Services," click, "Register and Repair your Product." Click on, "Request a Repair,"
Fill out the necessary information
Once completed, click on the console that you have just registered
Click on, "Request a Repair." Follow the steps, beginning with description of the problem and ending with review. If you prefer to call, dial 1-800-4MYXBOX. A customer service representative should be with you, but please be patient. Follow the directions from the representative. For shipping, go to the xbox.com/support. Under your consoles, there should be an option where you can print out a shipping label. Once printed, find a medium-large size box. If there are any marking on the box, scratch them out. Affix the shipping label to the top of the box.  Now, you need to pack your Xbox.  First, you need to remove the hard-drive. To do so, simply push-in the tab where the hard-drive is and the hard-drive should pop up. After the hard-drive is removed, it is recommended that the faceplate be removed from the console. To do this, simply pull the faceplate off via the sides. For easier assistance, type out a brief description of your problems with the console and include it in the box.  Now, time to wrap your Xbox.  First, find some bubble wrap. The kind with the smaller bubbles works best because it offers the most protection. Wrap the bubble wrap around the Xbox, starting from the front, wrap it about 2-3 times around.  Affix the brief description to the top of the wrapped console with packing tape.  Once the Xbox is wrapped, get some packing insulation and put on the bottom (Some common packing materials are newspaper, packing peanuts, Styrofoam, etc).  Put a thin layer of the packing material on the bottom of the box.  Set your Xbox on top, and put more packing material on the sides.  Close and tape the box.
